descendants.content:
1. It ignores the complicated feedbacks of our climate system. CO2 does many other things withing this complicated system than simply being present in the air we breathe. Therefore it is an intellectually lazy comment to make.

#ClimateSystem
#ClimateFeedbacks
#ClimateChange

account.note: Isotope #geochemist. Climate #scientist. Concerned #citizen. Person of precision, but one who knows when to sacrifice precision for accuracy. Studying past records of #climate and #carbon cycling since 1999. Frustrated that our scientifically advanced society seems impervious to scientific advice. Same handle on Xitter, but fully posting in the #fediverse since Nov. 2022.

descendants.content:
2. Related, he makes no effort to consider other species on which we depend. What about insects? Cows? Chickens? I don't have any good idea at what level increased CO2 would affect other animals, but to take such a human-centric view is stupid and lazy.

#Extinction
#CoDependencies
#ClimateFeedback
#ClimateChange

descendants.content:
3. Finally, he is able to ignore these things. He can be lazy because he has enough resources to deal with all of the complicated changes related to CO2 increase and he won't have to worry until he can't breathe. He has hoarded our wealth so when the food storages happen, he will still have food. When the sea rises, he will move. When the hurricanes and tornadoes come, he will have shelter. So he has become callous to the point where no one should pay attention to what he says.

And, still, he'll probably be sleeping in an oxygen tank when we're all scrounging for food and air.

card.title: Atmospheric CO2 levels can cause cognitive impairment
card.description: As the 21st century progresses, rising atmospheric carbon dioxide (CO2) concentrations will cause urban and indoor levels of the gas to increase, and that may significantly reduce our basic decision-making ability and complex strategic thinking, according to a new CU Boulder-led study.

descendants.content:
@peachfront @hydropsyche @Brad_Rosenheim I think we’re already there because of Covid brain damage. You haven’t noticed it in your community?

Everything I do I have to do three times because people can’t think anymore.

If I need to refill a prescription, I have to call Wallgreens at at least a week ahead of time to make sure they remember I can’t take the pink ones I can take any brand except the ones that are pink so I have to remind them even though they’ve been filling this prescription for me for at least two years that they need to order Different meds if they have only pink ones

They say no it’s fine we ordered some for you special. I say great. Can you fill that for me Friday morning so I can pick it up at 10? They say yes.

Two hours later I get a phone call from Wallgreens where the only message is “hello hello.” so I called them back, and I say somebody just called me? After a few minutes on hold they come back and they say “yes we’re calling to tell you that you can’t fill that prescription until Friday” so I say yes I know that’s why I asked you to have it ready Friday at 10, because Friday is Friday right? They say yes. So I say great can you fill it for me Friday at 10 and not the pink ones? They say yes. I say ok thanks (not sure why we had to have two extra phone calls but ok.)

So y’all, I show up on Friday at 10 to pick up my prescription and as I’m leaving I have enough sense to look at it. They are pink.

I go back through the drive-through and I talk to the pharmacist who says back in June you told me you could take the pink ones. And I said yes but in July I told the other pharmacist that I could not so he ordered the others. Then I spoke to him again last week and he had them. Then when I ordered them LAST NIGHT I reminded them I can’t take the pink ones

So again, this woman looks at me and says yes but you told me you could. I literally had to spell out for this woman that yesterday is more recent than June so that means something has changed since June and you need to work with the updated information which would have been yesterday when I said no pink ones.

It was absolutely insane. So to fill one prescription I had to have three telephone calls and I had to go through the drive-through twice because of course then I had to wait in the Walgreens parking lot for 15 minutes while she fixed it.

This sounds like a petty complaint and I’m sure people think I’m a Karen, but this is a medication that I take every single month for years. You can’t pick it up early because it’s a controlled substance. I have MECFS so when I have to make three phone calls about a prescription there’s no more phone calls being made that day meaning anything else that I have to do has to wait.

And you guys I’ve specifically been telling them since last spring that I cannot take these pink ones. I did have to take them in June because they didn’t order anything different despite multiple phone calls and when I’ve taken my last tablet and I find out that they won’t be able to fill it for three days if I don’t take the pink ones I had to take the pink ones and it didn’t work out.

But there’s nothing they can do they can’t replace the pharmacist if that pharmacist goes bad. There aren’t any here to spare. So even if Wallgreens knew she was growing up, even if she was physically harming patients with her errors, they would have to choose to close the pharmacy someday or keep the person who is harming patients because there’s nobody to replace her with
